columns.name: Name
columns.formula:
concatenate(
  "#",
  [Event #],
  ": ",
  If(
    [Special Title].IsNotBlank(),
    Concatenate(
      [Special Title],
      if(
        Topic.IsNotBlank(),
        Concatenate(" (", Topic.Topic, ")"),
        ""
      )
    ),
    Topic.Topic
  ),
  " at ",
  Chapter.[Local Trade Name]
    .IfBlank(
      Chapter.Chapter
    ),
  ", ",
  totext(Date)
)

columns.name: Add Standard Event Tasks and Info to Team Canvas

format.action:
ModifyRows(
  thisRow,
  [Team Canvas],
  Concatenate(
    format(Formatted, "Tasks"),
    [Standard Event Tasks]
      .sort(
        true, [Type Sort Order]
      )
      .[Event Project]
      .Unique()
      .FormulaMap(
        CurrentValue
          .WithName(
            currentProject,
            Concatenate(
              format(
                Formatted,
                currentProject.Type
              ),
              LineBreak(),
              [Standard Event Tasks]
                .filter(
                  [Event Project]
                    .Contains(
                      currentProject
                    )
                )
                .sort(
                  true, [Priority Order]
                )
                .FormulaMap(
                  CurrentValue
                    .WithName(
                      currentTask,
                      Concatenate(
                        format(
                          Formatted,
                          Concatenate(
                            _bold(currentTask.Task),
                            " ",
                            _italicize(
                              [Expected Duration].ToText()
                            ),
                            ", ",
                            Priority.Priority
                          )
                        ),
                        LineBreak(),
                        currentTask
                          .[Subtasks and Description]
                          .IndentBy(
                            1
                          )
                      )
                    )
                )
            )
          )
      ),
    [Team Canvas]
  )
)

columns.name: Banner

format.action: Activate(AddRow(Events, Chapter, Chapter, Venue, Venue, [Single-Entry Price], [Single-Entry Price], [Start Time], [Start Time], [End Time], [End Time], Date, Date+7))

Modifyrows(thisRow, [Public Thank You Message], OpenAIPrompt([Jon Dallas], "Write a public thank you message after a " + Chapter.[Local Trade Name].ToText() + " event exploring " + Topic.ToText() + ". Write in a concise, conversational, somewhat funny/serious tone. Write in the first-person. Start with an exclamation." + LineBreak() + "Express gratitude to everyone who came to the event last night for their honesty, vulnerabilty, and courage to speak and share their experiences and beliefs. Mention that the converstions were lively and deep. Start with 'I would like to thank'" + LineBreak() + LineBreak() + "In one paragraph, thank:" + LineBreak() + "The management and staff at " + Venue.ToText() + "for hosting our event." + if([Community Voices Speaker].isnotblank(), [Community Voices Speaker].ToText() + " for sharing their views, beliefs, journey, wisdom in a talk." + LineBreak(), "") + if(Musician.isnotblank(), Musician.ToText() + " for writing and performing a song that illustrated the dilemma and emotion in the TOPIC we explored." + LineBreak(), "") + if(Artist.isnotblank(), Artist.ToText() + " for creating artwork that illustrated the dilemma and emotion in the TOPIC we explored." + LineBreak(), "") + if([Front Door Manager].isnotblank(), [Front Door Manager].ToText() + " for managing the front door." + LineBreak(), "") + if(Photographer.isnotblank(), Photographer.ToText() + " for capturing photos of the event." + LineBreak(), "") + if(Videographer.isnotblank(), Videographer.ToText() + " for capturing video of the event." + LineBreak(), "") + if(Assistant.isnotblank(), Assistant.ToText() + " for all their assistance in the background", "") + if(Scribe.isnotblank(), Scribe.ToText() + " for taking down notes of the event." + LineBreak(), "") + if([Legal Adviser].isnotblank(), [Legal Adviser].ToText() + " for ensuring our discussion stayed within the bounds of the law." + LineBreak(), "") + if([Social Media Manager].isnotblank(), [Social Media Manager].ToText() + " for social media management." + LineBreak(), "") + "Start with 'I would like to thank'. Only mention each person's name once." + LineBreak() + LineBreak() + "Invite everyone to join our next event: " + Events.filter(Chapter.contains(Chapter) AND Date > Today()).sort(true, Date).[Date: Topic].first().ToText(), "gpt-4"))

columns.name: Special Notes to Include in Public Thank You
Calculated Total Revenue USD
columns.formula: [Calculated Entry Revenue]+[Calculated Food & Drink Sale Revenue]

columns.name: Total Attendees
columns.formula: [One-Time Paying Guests]+[New Membership Card Sales]+[Membership Card Uses]+[Free Guests]+[Team Members]

format.action:
[Roles DB].filter(Priority.contains(Necessary,Critical))
  .FormulaMap(
    AddRow(
      [Event Team Members],
      Event,
      thisRow,
      Role,
      CurrentValue
    )
  )

Events
  .filter(
    Chapter = Chapter AND
      Date < Date
  )
  .sort(
    false, Date
  )
  .First()
  .[Event Team Members]
  .FormulaMap(
    currentvalue.withname(currentPastEventTeamMember,
    AddRow(
      [Event Team Members],
      Event,
      thisRow,
      Role,
      currentPastEventTeamMember.Role,
      Name,
      currentPastEventTeamMember.Name
    )
  ))

columns.name: Event Info
columns.formula:
Concatenate(
   // EVENT INFO
  format(Formatted, "Event Info"),
  LineBreak(),
  BulletedList(
    Concatenate(_bold("Date: "), Date),
    Concatenate(
      _bold("Time: "),
      [Start Time] + minutes(30),
      " (Doors ",
      [Start Time],
      ")"
    ),
    Concatenate(_bold("Topic: "), Topic.ToText()),
    Concatenate(_bold("Locaton: "), Venue.ToText()),
    Concatenate(_bold("Chapter: "), Chapter.ToText()),
    Concatenate(
      _bold("Entry: "),
      [Single-Entry Price].ToText(),
      " (5 for ",
      [Membership Card Price],
      ")"
    ),
    Concatenate(_bold("Event #: "), [Event #])
  ),
  LineBreak(),
  // TEAM
  Concatenate(
format(Formatted, "Team"),
  LineBreak(),
  [Event Team Members]
    .filter(
      Name.IsNotBlank() and
        Role.IsNotBlank()
    )
    .FormulaMap(
      Concatenate(
        objectlink(
          CurrentValue.Name,
          CurrentValue.Name
        ),
        " - ",
        objectlink(
          CurrentValue.Role,
          CurrentValue.Role
        )
      )
    )
    .BulletedList()
    )
)

columns.name: Past Event Photos
Prompt to Generate Public Invitation Text
Copy Prompt to Generate Public Invitation Text
Copy Team Canvas from Last Event

format.action:
ModifyRows(
  thisRow,
  [Team Canvas],
  Events.filter(Chapter.Contains(Chapter) and [Team Canvas].IsNotBlank()).sort(false,Date).first().[Team Canvas]
)

columns.name: Calculated Entry Revenue
columns.formula: [One-Time Paying Guests]*[Single-Entry Price]+[New Membership Card Sales]*[Membership Card Price]

columns.name: Calculated Food & Drink Sale Revenue
columns.formula: [Food & Drink Venue Sales]*[Percent of Food/Drink Revenue Received]

columns.name: Profit Share Pool
columns.formula: [Actual Total Revenue USD]-[Actual Royalty USD]-[Total Event Expenses]-[Flat Fee Payments]-[Growth Fund Amount]

columns.name: Expense Report
columns.formula:
concatenate(
  "**Event #:** ",[Event #],LineBreak(),
  "**Date:** ",Date.ToText(),linebreak(),
  "**Chapter:** ",Chapter.ToText(),linebreak(),
  "**Topic/Title:** ",
  If(
    [Special Title].IsNotBlank(),
    Concatenate(
      [Special Title],
      if(
        Topic.IsNotBlank(),
        Concatenate(" (", Topic.Topic, ")"),
        ""
      )
    ),
    Topic.Topic
  ),LineBreak(),
  
  // REVENUE
  "#Event Revenue",LineBreak(),
  "## Entry",LineBreak(),
  "**One-time ticket price:** ",[Single-Entry Price],LineBreak(),
  "**Membership Card Price:** ",[Membership Card Price],LineBreak(),
  "**One-time paying guests:** ",[One-Time Paying Guests],LineBreak(),
  "**Membership Cards Sold:** " ,[New Membership Card Sales],LineBreak(),
  "**Membership Card Uses:** ",[Membership Card Uses],LineBreak(),
  "**Team Members:** ",[Team Members],LineBreak(),
  "**Free Guests:** ",[Free Guests],LineBreak(),
  "**Free Guest Description:** ",[Free Guest Description],LineBreak(),
  "**Total Attendees:* ",[Total Attendees],LineBreak(),
  "**Entry Revenue:** ",[Calculated Entry Revenue],linebreak(),
  "## Food & Drink Sales",LineBreak(),
  "**Food and Drink Sales:** ",[Food & Drink Venue Sales],LineBreak(),
  "**Percent of Food/Drink Sales Received:** ",[Percent of Food/Drink Revenue Received],LineBreak(),
  "**Food & Drink Sales Revenue:** ",[Calculated Food & Drink Sale Revenue],LineBreak(),
  "##Total",LineBreak(),
  "**Calculated Total Revenue:** ",[Calculated Total Revenue USD],LineBreak(),
  "**Actual Total Revenue:** ",[Actual Total Revenue USD],LineBreak(),

  // DEDUCTIONS
  "#Deductions",LineBreak(),
  "**Flat Fee Team Members:** ",[Event Team Members].Filter([Flat Fee].IsNotBlank()).[Flat Fee].sum(),LineBreak(),
  [Event Team Members].Filter([Flat Fee].IsNotBlank()).FormulaMap(Concatenate(
    CurrentValue.Name.ToText()," (",CurrentValue.Role.ToText(),") - ",CurrentValue.[Flat Fee]
    )
  ).BulletedList(),LineBreak(),
  "**Roalty Fee:** (",Chapter.Royalty,") ",[Actual Royalty USD],linebreak(),
  "**Growth Fund:** (",[Growth Fund Percent],") ",[Growth Fund Amount],linebreak(),
  "**Event Expenses: **",[Event Expenses].filter(Category.Contains([Event Expense])).[Amount USD].sum(),LineBreak(),
  [Event Expenses].filter(Category.Contains([Event Expense])).FormulaMap(
    Concatenate(
      [Amount USD]," ",Type," - ",Details
    )
  ).BulletedList()
)

columns.name: Deductions
columns.formula: [Growth Fund Amount]+[Actual Royalty USD]+[Total Event Expenses]+[Flat Fee Payments]

values.Public Invitation Text:
Excited for you to join us for Real Talk Harare‚Äôs exploration of the arguments for/against Polyamory!
Thursday, 15 August
6-9pm (Sundowners at 5:30)
Is polyamory or monogamy more "natural"? Why are bisexuals more likely to practice polyamory? Should we allow children to be raised in polyamorous households? What are the best reasons to practice polyamory? What are the best reasons not to?
What to expect:
üë• Community discussions with curated questions
üß† Balanced talks exploring various viewpoints
üé® Original artwork by local artists
üéµ Live music from AneUnhu
ü•á Community creativity contests
üçΩÔ∏è Food and drink available
Tickets: $10
Financial assistance available - please contact if needed.
If you‚Äôve been in the past, bring a first-time attendee, and you get in for free!
For more information: www.realtalkphilosophy.org
Meaningful dialogue in a respectful environment. All perspectives welcome!

Talk through the slides/questions

Research more

values.Name: #235: Masculinity: Toxic? (Toxic Masculinity) at Real Talk Harare, Tue, Jul 4, 2023
Banner: IMG_2351.jpg
values.Public Thank You Message:
Shoutout, Harare!
I would like to thank every sociopolitically savvy person who braved their fears and brought their open minds to the Toxic Masculinity Talk last night at The Jam Tree. The ambiance was electric with honesty, vulnerability, hilarious interruptions and some serious thought-provoking discussions.
I would like to thank The Jam Tree, not just for their delicious food and drinks, but also for turning their fantastic venue into our little safe haven where we could strip down our biases and pretenses, and explore an issue as serious as Toxic Masculinity.
Immense gratitude goes out to Michael Watson, who not only shared his remarkable journey and wisdom but challenged the existing discourse around the topic. His views and beliefs moved the conversation from the usual clich√©s to the real issues at hand.
Our very own LoveDale Makalanga is due a gargantuan 'thank you' for his heartfelt song‚Äîa beautiful symphony that captured the dilemma and complex emotions encompassing Toxic Masculinity. His melodious lines kept us swaying between laughter and, dare I say, a tear or two.
Lucy Kirkman, oh where do we even start with her? Thank you, Lucy, for your mesmerizing artwork which served as a mirror to our society, showcasing the emotional turbulence within the theme we explored.
But wait! Not one to shy away from more responsibility, LoveDale Makalanga once again graced us, not just on stage, but behind the scenes as well, managing tasks, people, and the unexpected hitches with impeccable poise.
Finally, keep your schedules cleared for the 7/11/2023! Prepare for a mind-bending deep dive into another inscrutable topic - Free Will. Until then, stay quirky and keep questioning!

values.Notes:
Message to Individuals
[personal greeting]
I'm finally starting up Real Talk Philosophy events in Harare next week üòäü•≥ 
Could I add you to our WhatsApp group for event details, etc.?
[attach flyer] 
The goal of the first message is just to get permission to add the person to the group. No need for too much information at this point. 

Our first event will be next Thursday, 25/5 on The Ethics of Comedy. We‚Äôll explore the evolutionary origins of laughter, the enigma of villains' laughter versus heroes' seriousness, the case of Louis CK, and the delicate balance of sensitive subjects like rape jokes and Holocaust humor with talks, small-group discussions, live music, artwork, games, and more.

Message to Group
The Ethics of Comedy - Real Talk Harare
Thursday, 25/5 at 6pm
First event is FREE
BYOB, $4 vegetarian curry available
Leave the small talk at the door and join us for ‚ÄúThe Ethics of Comedy.‚Äù In this event, we will explore the evolutionary origins of laughter, the delicate balance of sensitive jokes (e.g. about rape or the Holocaust), the controversial case of Louis CK, and the enigma of villains' laughter versus heroes' seriousness.
Itinerary
üö™ Doors open at 6pm
image.png Event starts at 6:30pm
image.png Community discussions with curated questions
image.png Talks exploring the evolutionary origins of laughter and the ethics of comedy. 
image.png Pre-recorded interview with Emma Cooper, founder of the comedy troupe Rape is Real and Everywhere
image.png Live performance of "Don't Laugh About It" by Jame-Claire Chau
image.png Artwork from Lara Hardie Stewart and more
image.png Community Haiku and Drawing Contest
image.png $4 veg curry and BYOB 
image.png After Party
Pricing
This first event is FREE, but future events will be $10
Parking
Parking is tight (hence the RSVP cut-off)! Soon we‚Äôll move to a proper venue, but for now we have space for 4 cars inside the gate, and 6 cars across the street. Arrive early to claim your spot!
